Docs.summary: SubscriptionClient can be used for all basic interactions with a Service Bus Subscription.
Docs.remarks: Use for advanced set of functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task AddRuleAsync (Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.RuleDescription description);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task AddRuleAsync(class Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.RuleDescription description) cil managed
Public Function AddRuleAsync (description As RuleDescription) As Task
abstract member AddRuleAsync : Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.RuleDescription -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task
public: System::Threading::Tasks::Task ^ AddRuleAsync(Microsoft::Azure::ServiceBus::RuleDescription ^ description);

Docs.param: The rule description that provides the rule to add.
Docs.summary: Adds a rule to the current subscription to filter the messages reaching from topic to the subscription.
Docs.returns: A task instance that represents the asynchronous add rule operation.
Docs.remarks: You can add rules to the subscription that will decide filter which messages from the topic should reach the subscription. A default rule named is always added while creation of the Subscription. You can add multiple rules with distinct names to the same subscription. Multiple filters combine with each other using logical OR condition. i.e., If any filter succeeds, the message is passed on to the subscription.

Docs.param: The filter expression against which messages will be matched.
Docs.summary: Adds a rule to the current subscription to filter the messages reaching from topic to the subscription.

Docs.remarks: You can add rules to the subscription that will decide filter which messages from the topic should reach the subscription. A default rule named is always added while creation of the Subscription. You can add multiple rules with distinct names to the same subscription. Multiple filters combine with each other using logical OR condition. i.e., If any filter succeeds, the message is passed on to the subscription.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterSessionHandler(class System.Func`4<class Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.IMessageSession, class Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken, class System.Threading.Tasks.Task> handler, class Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.SessionHandlerOptions sessionHandlerOptions) cil managed

Docs.param: A that processes messages. contains the session information, and must be used to perform Complete/Abandon/Deadletter or other such operations on the
Options used to configure the settings of the session pump.
Docs.summary: Receive session messages continuously from the subscription. Registers a message handler and begins a new thread to receive session-messages. This handler() is awaited on every time a new message is received by the subscription client.
Docs.remarks: Enable prefetch to speed up the receive rate.

A that is invoked during exceptions. contains contextual information regarding the exception.
Docs.summary: Receive session messages continuously from the subscription. Registers a message handler and begins a new thread to receive session-messages. This handler() is awaited on every time a new message is received by the subscription client.
Docs.remarks: Enable prefetch to speed up the receive rate. Use to configure the settings of the pump.
